data.title: Ottumwa Daily Courier
data.meta_description: Jack Wagner passed away. This is the full obituary where you can share condolences and memories. Published in the Ottumwa Daily Courier on 2018-04-20.
data.text:
Jack Arthur Wagner, 56, of Hedrick, died at 7:04 a.m. April 20, 2018 at Iowa Methodist Medical Center in Des Moines. He was born December 3, 1961 in Ottumwa to Jack Arthur and Gesina "Cindy" J. Acord Wagner. He married JoAnn Byrum Rea on August 4, 2001. Jack attended Ottumwa High School and received training as an auto mechanic from Indian Hills Community College. Jack had worked at Sea World in Florida in pyrotechnics, had worked 13 years at Ray-Man in Keota and was currently working for Vermeer as a welder. He loved and had a great knowledge of music, and enjoyed playing the guitar. Jack was soft spoken and kind. He was very quick and witty. Jack loved animals including his four-legged babies at home. In high school he was known as the cool guy with a fringe jacket and long hair. Surviving is his wife and the love of his life, JoAnn; children, J.D. Wagner (Andrea) of Lamar, AR, Nicholas Rea (Angela Galecki) of St. Petersburg, FL and Wendi Rea (Paul) of Baltimore, MD; 3 grandchildren; his father, Jack (Janice) Wagner of Ottumwa; siblings, Brenda R. Poole, Jerry Wagner, Gary McNamer, Bill Wagner, Tracy McNamer, Kim Wagner, Jason Wagner and Shawn McNamer; numerous nieces and nephews. He was preceded in death by his mother, Cindy McNamer; grandparents, Walter and Isabelle Long, Babe and Helen Wagner. Funeral services will be 1 p.m. Wednesday at Reece Funeral Home. Cremation will follow the services. Visitation begins at 11 a.m. Tuesday with the family present from 5 p.m. to 7 p.m. Tuesday. Memorials may be made to Second Chance Dog Rescue of Iowa.

Published on April 20, 2018

Note: These are general guidelines; some florists may not be able to operate within these timelines. During peak periods such as Valentineâ€™s Day, Memorial Day and most holidays, florists are not always able to keep up to demand. Tribute will contact you if there are any issues.

Plant a tree: How does it work

When your purchase is complete, a post will be made on the tribute wall of the deceased signifying the planting of a memorial tree.

An official certificate recognizing your purchase will be included with your email receipt. You can then forward the email to the family or print it and give it to them personally.

After an order is placed, our forestry partners will plant the tree in the area of greatest need (nearest the funeral home), according to the planting schedule for the year.

Due to seasonal conditions, the tree planting takes place during the spring and summer.

Tree Planting Timeline

Orders placed in:

January - May

Planting will take place in Spring or Summer of the same year.

June - December

Planting will take place in Spring of the following year.
